title: What You Missed: Virginia Governor’s Debate
content: Former Gov. Terry McAuliffe, a Democrat, and Glenn Youngkin, a Republican, clashed Tuesday night. Here’s what to know.

title: Milley, Austin and McKenzie Face House Panel, a Day After Senate Testimony
content: The three top U.S. defense officials have a second day of congressional testimony on Wednesday, this time in front of the House Armed Services Committee.

title: How to Build a Paid Family Leave Plan That Doesn’t Backfire
content: Congress is designing a policy as part of Democrats’ safety net spending plan. Evidence from around the world suggests what works and what doesn’t.

title: Republicans at Odds Over Infrastructure Bill as Vote Approaches
content: With a bipartisan infrastructure bill set for a Thursday vote in the House, a campaign by business groups and some Senate Republicans to secure G.O.P. support may be the measure’s last hope.

title: ‘This Was a Failure’: Biden’s A.T.F. Pick Says White House Left Him Open to Attack
content: David Chipman’s defeat was a loss for gun control groups, which saw the appointment of a strong director as the most important move the president could make on guns.

title: Military Officials Say They Urged Biden Against Afghanistan Withdrawal
content: During a heated Senate hearing, Gen. Mark Milley also defended his actions in the final months of the Trump administration.

title: How the Huawei Case Raised Fears of ‘Hostage Diplomacy’ by China
content: Critics of the Justice Department deal to free the Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou say it could blunt tools like sanctions and prosecutions.

title: How the Debt Ceiling Came to Be a Political Cudgel
content: The current fight over raising the debt limit is proving to be another lesson in American political dysfunction.

title: Navient, with six million borrowers, asks to stop servicing federal student loans.
content: Navient is the second major federal student loan servicer to ask to get out of the business. FedLoan said in July that it wanted out.

title: McKenzie suggests the U.S. may not be able to prevent Al Qaeda and ISIS from rebuilding in Afghanistan.
content: Gen. Kenneth F. McKenzie Jr., the head of the military’s Central Command, was somewhat more pessimistic than other top Pentagon officials testifying before a Senate panel.

title: With his reappointment on the line, Elizabeth Warren calls Jerome Powell ‘a dangerous man.’
content: Other Democrats fretted about diversity at the Federal Reserve as Chair Jerome H. Powell testified ahead of an imminent personnel shake-up.

title: Milley defends his actions at the end of Trump’s term, saying top officials knew of his calls to China.
content: “My loyalty to this nation, its people, and the Constitution hasn’t changed and will never change as long as I have a breath to give,” Gen. Mark A. Milley said.

title: In a call with Pelosi after the Capitol riot, Milley agreed that Trump was ‘crazy,’ book says.
content: Two days after Trump supporters stormed the Capitol, Gen. Mark A. Milley spoke to Speaker Nancy Pelosi, who was worried Mr. Trump would lash out with military force.

title: Trump Loses Case to Enforce Omarosa Manigault Newman’s N.D.A.
content: Donald Trump had filed the case against Ms. Manigault Newman, a former White House aide and “Apprentice” star, after she wrote a tell-all book about serving in his administration.

title: Stephanie Grisham’s Book Details Trump’s ‘Terrifying’ Temper
content: The former press secretary is reflective in her tell-all: “I should have spoken up more.”

title: Milley reassured a top Chinese general that Trump would not attack, a recent book says.
content: “Things may look unsteady,” Gen. Mark A. Milley reportedly told the Chinese general two days after President Trump’s supporters stormed the Capitol. “But that’s the nature of democracy.”

title: Top defense officials acknowledge they advised against withdrawing all troops from Afghanistan.
content: Tuesday’s appearance by Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III, Gen. Mark A. Milley and Gen. Kenneth F. McKenzie, Jr. was the start of back-to-back Senate and House hearings.

title: Yellen Warns of ‘Catastrophic’ Consequences From Debt Limit Breach
content: The Treasury secretary, testifying alongside Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, implored Congress to raise or suspend the nation’s borrowing cap before an Oct. 18 deadline.
